text: interesting read that touches on how OCR was leveraged to beat CAPTCHA by botmakers outsmarting Ticketmaster: <https://motherboard.vice.com/en_us/article/mgxqb8/the-man-who-broke-ticketmaster>

attachments.title: The Man Who Broke Ticketmaster
attachments.text: The most infamous ticket scalper of all time used bots to buy millions of tickets. Now he wants to stop them.
attachments.fallback: Motherboard: The Man Who Broke Ticketmaster

text: i once did work for Live Nation (by far my worst client in 2 decades). they are owned by tickmaster. in the kickoff i somehow accidentally called them "Ticketmonster" - which was one of my biggest agency fuck-ups ever.
luckily, the clients laughed. they didn't like ticketmaster much either.
:laughing: I've heard worse nicknames for them. Seriously not a fan of either of those brands
